page.title: 01Melbourn & part of Meldreth
page.content: The topography is flat, beginning to roll gently away from the S. E. corner. The combined population of the villages{is approximately 7,000. They {are mentioned in Domesday and contain {an interesting cross section of {buildings dating from the twelfth {century. Their situation vis-a-vis {communications by road and railway is {good, which has led to considerable {residential and light industrial {development during the past fifteen {years also to a 'dormitory to London' {situation. A main road bye-pass is {urgently needed by Melbourne, the {result of a Public Enquiry into which {will be published shortly. Melbourn {is the focal point for a number of {villages in South Cambridgeshire, {praticularly through the Village {College amenities. { }
